official-title.#text:
To provide that members of the Armed Forces performing hazardous humanitarian services in West
			 Africa to combat the spread of the 2014 Ebola virus outbreak shall be
			 entitled to tax benefits in the same manner as if such services were
			 performed in a combat zone.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Operation United Assistance Tax Exclusion Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Operation United Assistance Tax Exclusion Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Treatment of certain hazardous humanitarian service as combat zone service for purposes of the
			 combat zone compensation exclusion

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, service by a qualified member of
			 the Armed Forces during Operation United Assistance shall be treated as
			 service in a combat zone in the same manner as if the

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
had by Executive Order designated the Ebola virus disease
			 outbreak area as an area of combat under

term.#tail:
means a member of the Armed Forces serving in Operation United Assistance who is required to
			 undergo a program of not less than 21 days of controlled monitoring in a
			 controlled monitoring area upon the individual's return from the Ebola
			 virus disease outbreak area.
term.#text: qualified member of the Armed Forces

header.#text: Qualified member of the Armed Forces

term.#tail: means the mission beginning in September 2014 in the Ebola virus disease outbreak area.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
as experiencing a widespread Ebola virus
			 disease outbreak as of the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Centers for
			 Disease Control and Prevention

term.#tail: means Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Guinea, and any other region designated by the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5804 IH: Operation United Assistance Tax Exclusion Act of 2014
